info.title: Sorting-related messages API Specifications
info.description: Specifications for messages that support livestock sorting management.

tags.name: ADE-1.5-sorting
tags.description: Sorting messages approved by the working group

get.summary: Get the sorting-sites for a certain location
get.description:
# Purpose
Provides the sorting-sites for a location

200.description: Successful. The response contains the resources for the given location.

get.summary: Get the sorting of a certain animal for a certain site
get.description:
# Purpose
Provides the sorting of a certain animal

200.description: Successful. The response contains the resources for the given location.

delete.summary: Delete sorting for a certain animal of a location
delete.description:
# Purpose
Provides the deletion of sorting for a location

get.summary: Get the known sorting-commands for all animals of a certain location
get.description:
# Purpose
Provides the known sorting-commands for all animals of a location

200.description: Successful. The response contains the resources for the given location.

post.summary: Add an animal into a sorting-site.
post.description:
# Purpose
Allows a client to add an animal to a sorting-site

requestBody.description:
The sorting of an animal to be create. 
A client MAY fill in the *Id* field with a client-generated UUID and the server MAY use this *Id*.
If the server does not use the client-specified *ID* field it shall issue its own *ID* for the resource.
A client SHALL ensure that the *meta.source* and *meta.sourceId* fields are filled by the client.

200.description: Successful. The response contains a copy of the event, as modified by the server.

201.description: Created. The Location header contains the URI to the new resource.

Location.description: Contains the URI to the new resource.

202.description: Accepted. The Location header contains a URI that the client can query for processing status.

Location.description: Contains a URI to query creation status.

icarAnimalSortingCommandCollection.description: Represents a collection of animal-sorting-commands. Based on icarResourceCollection to provide paging etc.

member.description: As per JSON-LD Hydra syntax, member provides the array of objects, in this case animal sorting commands (icarAnimalSortingCommandResource).

icarSortingSiteCollection.description: Represents a collection of sites. Based on icarResourceCollection to provide paging etc.

member.description: As per JSON-LD Hydra syntax, member provides the array of objects, in this case sorting-sites.

icarAnimalSortingCommandResource.description: Sorting data for a specific animal on a location.

animal.description: Unique animal scheme and identifier combination.

sites.description: Array with unique site identifiers where this animal can be sorted to.

validFrom.description: Specifies from when the sort command should be active. RFC3339 UTC date time (see https://ijmacd.github.io/rfc3339-iso8601/ for format guidance).

validTo.description: Specifies until when the sort command should be active. Could be left empty, when the sorting should be ongoing (until replaced). RFC3339 UTC date time (see https://ijmacd.github.io/rfc3339-iso8601/ for format guidance).

icarBatchResultSeverityType.description: Severity code to distinguish warnings and errors.

icarResponseMessageResource.description: An RFC7807 compliant problem response for JSON APIs.

type.description: Machine readable URI or code that defines the type of error or warning.

severity.description: Distinguish errors, warnings, and informational messages.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. Like title, this fieldâ€™s value can be localized.

instance.description: A URI reference or internal JSON document reference to the specific data item that caused the problem.

icarErrorCollection.description: A collection of RFC7807 compliant problem responses for JSON APIs.

icarResourceCollection.description: Base class for a collection of items such as animals, devices, or events. Use allOf to add an items array of the right type.

view.description: Information about the current view or page of the collection

totalItems.description: Provides the number of items in the collection, if known.

totalPages.description: Provides the number of pages in the collection, if known.

pageSize.description: If non-zero, specifies the default number of items returned per page.

currentPage.description: Optionally identifies the current page for display purposes, if returned.

first.description: Link to the first page of the collection. Link relation: first.

next.description: Link to the next page of the collection, if any. Link relation: next.

prev.description: Link to the previous page of the collection, if any. Link relation: prev.

last.description: Link to the last page of the collection, if any. Link relation: last.

icarDateTimeType.description: A particular point in the progression of time. Shall be UTC format with Z, specified in RFC3339 (see https://ijmacd.github.io/rfc3339-iso8601/ for format guidance).

icarMetaDataType.description: Generic meta data on this event

source.description: Source where data is retrieved from. URI  or reverse DNS that identifies the source system.

sourceId.description:
Unique Id within Source (e.g. UUID, IRI, URI, or composite ID if needed) for the resource in the original source system. 
 Systems should generate (if needed), store, and return sourceId if at all possible.
ICAR ADE working group intend to make use of metadata, source and sourceId mandatory in the next major release (2.0).

isDeleted.description: Boolean value indicating if this resource has been deleted in the source system.

modified.description: RFC3339 UTC date/time of last modification (see https://ijmacd.github.io/rfc3339-iso8601/ for format guidance).

created.description: RFC3339 UTC date/time of creation (see https://ijmacd.github.io/rfc3339-iso8601/ for format guidance).

creator.description: Person or organisation who created the object

validFrom.description: RFC3339 UTC start of period when the resource is valid (see https://ijmacd.github.io/rfc3339-iso8601/ for format guidance).

validTo.description: RFC3339 UTC end of the period when the resoure is valid (see https://ijmacd.github.io/rfc3339-iso8601/ for format guidance).

id.description: A unique identification for the resource issued under the auspices of the scheme.

scheme.description: The identifier (in reverse domain format) of an official scheme that manages unique identifiers.

icarLocationIdentifierType.description: Location identifier based on a scheme and ID.

icarResource.description: Base class for a resource, defining self-link and meta data. Resources should use AllOf to incorporate this class.

resourceType.description: Uniform resource identifier (URI) or shortname of the logical resourceType. The ResourceType catalog defines the set of allowed resourceTypes.

@self.description: Uniform resource identifier (URI) of the resource (rel=self).

meta.description:
Meta-data for the resource. Mandatory if you wish to support synchronisation.
 Systems should maintain and provide meta data if at all possible.
ICAR ADE working group intend meta to be required in the next major release of ADE.

location.description: Unique location scheme and identifier combination.

id.description: Unique identifier in the system for this site.

name.description: Name of the site as it is known on the location.

capacity.description: The maximum capacity of this site.

icarAnimalIdentifierType.description: Identifies an animal using a scheme and ID.

location-scheme.name: location-scheme
location-scheme.description: The scheme id for the location identifier.

location-id.name: location-id
location-id.description: The unique identifier for the location.

animal-scheme.name: animal-scheme
animal-scheme.description: The scheme id for the animal identifier.

animal-id.name: animal-id
animal-id.description: The unique identifier for the animal.

default.description: An error has occured while handling the request. Check the content of the message for the error details.
